title: Update regarding EcoPower
story_body:
Velocity Motors Launches EV-X500, Poses Significant Threat to EcoPower's Flagship Product

At 09:00 EST, Velocity Motors (VELO) unveiled the EV-X500, a cutting-edge electric vehicle boasting advanced features and improved performance. The launch poses a significant competitive threat to EcoPower (ECO), whose flagship battery technology is utilized in Velocity Motors' existing product line.

The EV-X500's advanced powertrain and battery management system, also supplied by EcoPower, enables a substantial increase in range and efficiency. Velocity Motors' decision to integrate these enhancements into a new product may render EcoPower's flagship battery technology, currently used in Velocity Motors' vehicles, obsolete.

Key specifications of the EV-X500 include a maximum range of 375 miles on a single charge, a 0-60 mph acceleration time of 3.2 seconds, and advanced regenerative braking capabilities. These features surpass those of EcoPower's flagship product, potentially undermining its market position.

The EV-X500's launch is scheduled for Q2 2024, with pre-orders commencing on March 15, 2024, at 12:00 EST. Velocity Motors has not disclosed pricing information at this time.

EcoPower's reliance on Velocity Motors as a key customer may be impacted by the EV-X500's release, as the latter's adoption of advanced battery technology could lead to reduced demand for EcoPower's existing products. The competitive threat posed by the EV-X500 will likely be a topic of discussion during EcoPower's upcoming earnings call, scheduled for February 27, 2024, at 16:00 EST.
